name: Jia Wu 0001
content: Jia Wu's Homepage Welcome to Jia Wu's Homepage Top Welcome to Professor Jia Wu's Homepage Prof Jia Wu is an ARC Future Fellow (Level 3, 2026 - 2030) and Full Professor in the School of Computing at Macquarie University. Dr Wu is the Research Director for the Centre for Applied Artificial Intelligence, Macquarie University. Dr Wu is the Director of Higher Degree Research (HDR) in the School of Computing at Macquarie University. Dr Wu was recognised as a National Leader, the only researcher across Australia to receive this title in the field of Databases and Information Systems, by The Australian’s Research 2025 magazine. Dr Wu was selected as a 2024 Highly Cited Researcher (Clarivate™), placing him among the top 0.1% of researchers worldwide in Computer Science. Dr Wu was awarded the prestigious 2025 CORE Award for Outstanding Research Contribution (known prior to 2023 as the Chris Wallace Award), granted to *ONLY ONE* academic each year from an Australian or New Zealand university or research institution. -------------------------------------------- Associate Editor (2024 - ), IEEE Transactions on Neural Networks and Learning Systems (TNNLS), JCR Q1, CORE A*, Impact Factor 8.9. Associate Editor (2017- ), ACM Transactions on Knowledge Discovery from Data (TKDD), JCR Q1, Impact Factor 4.8. Associate Editor (2018- ), Neural Networks, Elsevier, JCR Q1, CORE A, Impact Factor 6.3. Associate Editor (2018- ), Neurocomputing, Elsevier, JCR Q1, Impact Factor 6.5. Associate Editor (2017- ), Journal of Network and Computer Applications, Elsevier, JCR Q1, CORE A, Impact Factor 8.0. -------------------------------------------- Dr Wu and his research team have received prestigious competitive awards and recognitions, including Microsoft Research PhD Fellowship (2022), three Vice-Chancellor’s Commendations (PhD), seven Executive Dean’s Commendations (MRes), and the recipient of the Best Paper Award (ADMA 2024), the Best Paper Runner-Up Award (ACM CIKM 2022), the Best Paper Award Honorable Mention (ACM CIKM 2022), the Best Student Paper Award (IEEE ICDM 2021), the Best Paper Award in Data Science Track (SDM 2018), the Best Student Paper Award (IJCNN 2017), and Best Paper Candidate Award (ICDM 2014). He is a Senior Member of the IEEE. Research Interests Graph Mining LLM Knowledge Graphs Graph Neural Networks Recommended Systems Social Networks Time Series Analysis Deep Learning Graph Search Multi-objective Optimisation Anomaly Detection Brain Graph Analysis Address 4 Research Park Drive, Macquarie Park, NSW 2113, Australia Email: jia.wu@mq.edu.au Call for Students I am seeking highly motivated and focused students with Backgrounds & Interests in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Busissness, Management and Bioinformatics. PhD scholarships are OFFERED with topics Graph Mining LLM Knowledge Graph Graph Neural Networks Recommended Systems Graph search Deep Learning Anomaly Detection Time Series Analysis Brain Graphs/Networks Multi-objective optimisation Business Data Intelligence Recruiting Students PhD Scholarships now OPEN for 2026 commencement Graph Anomaly Detection Research Topics: node-level, edge-level , graph-level anomaly detection, dynamic graph anomaly detection, graph diffusion models Closing Date: 2 March 2026 Graph Mining Theory Research Topics: graph neural networks, graph explainability, dynamic graph mining, graph reinforced learning Closing Date: 2 March 2026 LLM and Knowledge Graphs Research Topics: LLM, NLP, Text Mining, Knowledge Graphs Closing Date: 2 March 2026 How to apply: Contact me first and make an online applications If you are interested in applying for the above scholarships, please email jia.wu@mq.edu.au Selected Publications CompleteList: DBLP or Google Conferences Nian Rong, Fei Xiong, Shirui Pan, Guixun Luo, Jia Wu, Liang Wang, Domain-Level Disentanglement Framework Based on Information Enhancement for Cross-Domain Cold-Start Recommendation, Proceedings of the 39th AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence (AAAI), USA, 2025.
